data.title: Added burning trees to the Tiberian Dawn mod
data.body:
:evergreen_tree: can catch :fire: but only with flame inducing weaponry. They leave a scorched charcoaled tree, but can't be chopped down completely. Artwork for destructible fauna is available, but I fear the balancing shit storm as maps have been designed with trees as indestructible barriers in mind. Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6403. I can set up RA :deciduous_tree: as well if this gets positive feedback.

PS: Added an additional lint test to catch my own copy & paste mistakes which will crash later on: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Buildings/FootprintUtils.cs#L51

data.title: Minor trait caching tweaks
data.body: I couldn't find any noteworthy low-hanging fruits, though the `ResourceLayer` caching in `PoisonedByTiberium` might be worthwhile with lots of actors on the map.

data.title: Buildings displayed over / clipping trough passing units
data.body:
(playtest 20160424)
Moving units (tested on vehicles) near edgy buildings results in clipping similar to the one in the screenshot:

![openra-2016-04-24t145136z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/14768264/7bb846f6-0a3d-11e6-9275-bbda69fe06ed.jpg)

Recreating this is easier with big units (mamooth) and buildings that have sharp corners and have edges parallel to the screen edges (war factory) - not positioned diagonally.

data.title: Make SupportPowerChargeBar and the SupportPowerTimer customizable with stances
data.body:
~~As a workaround for #11048.~~

~~If we show the timer, we now also show the charge bar (both is customizable with a stances field now).~~

~~(If this is merged before the next release, I'd like to get it into `stable`. It's not compulsory though.)~~

EDIT:

> This now only adds support to switch the charge bars and timers on/off based on stances.

data.title: Query lobby checkbox state via their owning traits.
data.body:
This continues the work started by #10857 to migrate from hardcoded lobby options to a more flexible trait-driven system.

The direct checks against the boolean `World.LobbyInfo.GlobalSettings.*` values are replaced with checks against the respective checkbox-owning traits.  A future PR (see [pchote:lobby-trait-options](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commits/lobby-trait-options) for a WIP preview) will then be able to swap out the `INotifyCreated.Created` implementations without having to deal with all of these outside references.

data.title: Chrono squishing logic is proably broken
data.body:
Here you can see me using chronosphere on my/enemy units for squishing. This logic is useful against enemy stationary tanyas/infantry blobs, esp. shockies blobs etc., since you can kill up to 25 at once. In current state you either need to use your own troops (likely sacrificing them) or another enemy's troops, since using enemy on himself is blocked (xmass release).

Here you can see several test cases.

1) using your own troops

![your_troops](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/14767052/f3093bf0-0a1c-11e6-81a2-1e5ecfd4817d.png)

If you try to move your tanks on yourself, chrono discharges (you waste it) and unit that would kill your infantry is not affected by chrono at all. See medium tank vs. light tank chronoed at once.

![your_on_yourself](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/14767056/1661b244-0a1d-11e6-9bfb-b40a14a3b50c.png)

![your_on_yourself_done](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/14767057/1b2a7dce-0a1d-11e6-9d9a-9b3dbe0a5366.png)

(I didn't document myself on enemy chrono, but it works, I did it several times)

2) using enemy troops

![enemy_troops](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/14767062/4af56abe-0a1d-11e6-832b-c3bf5068feff.png)

Now, with enemy tanks situation is bit more complicated. If you try to use them on yourself, (why would you, but okay), it works.

![enemy_on_you](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/14767069/67b03a30-0a1d-11e6-90d9-8b12e874d3bf.png)

![enemy_on_you_done](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/14767080/a5846a98-0a1d-11e6-8f27-78554c313482.png)

If you do it on another enemy, it works too. (Not shown after but it worked)

![enemy_on_another_enemy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/14767081/b15e71f6-0a1d-11e6-854b-b79d032a31ed.png)

The main issue is that you can't chrono his own tanks onto his own infantry, which if you are playing 1v1 is only way to hurt him this way and not sacrifice some tanks.

![enemy_on_himself](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/14767092/d91f4f80-0a1d-11e6-8291-746d9ed721dd.png)

data.title: Disable OwnerRow on TD and RA map props
data.body:
...and fix Owners of some trees and tib trees on Lessons from Kosovo and Treasure Island.

Closes #11173.

data.title: Blossom Trees in TD showing player ownership (release)
data.body:
http://i.imgur.com/ONAXcHE.png

Spectating is not the issue, is visible while playing.

data.title: Fix a crash when multi-turreted units leave a transport.
data.body: Fixes #11171.

data.title: Actor x has multiple traits of type `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Turreted`
data.body: Hello, I figured this isn't supposed to happen, but this error is thrown whenever a unit with more than 1 turret leaves a unit that can carry it in it's cargo (IE water transport or paradrop). It is relatively easy to reproduce, make a tank with 2 turrets, Turreted@primary, @secondary, etc. then insert it into a paradrop power or into a water transport, any attempt to empty the cargo with this unit inside it will cause the game to throw the error.

data.title: Fix missile facing check.
Set individual shapes and shape offsets for non-building TS actors
data.body:
Split from #10383 to make it less intimidating and serves as its test case.

This PR really only consists of the last 6 commits.

data.title: Add support for custom vertical HitShape offsets
data.body:
Makes it possible to define custom vertical top and bottom offsets for `HitShapes` relative to actor `CenterPosition`.

Split from #10383 (minus the `TargetPositions` adaption, obviously) to reduce its diff.

data.title: Fix GPS satellite palette.
data.body:
A simple fix for a shocking oversight (how could nobody have noticed this in the last N years?).
I'd like to take this for stable if nobody objects because it fits nicely with our "polish the GPS satellite feature" theme during this cycle.

data.title: Only refresh tooltip/health status of revealed frozen actors.
data.body: Fixes #11047.

data.title: Fix missile facing check.
data.body: Fixes #10305, which happens when the desired / current horizontal facing jitters between 255 and 0.

data.title: Additional useful lint tests
data.body:
- [ ] Actors with rendering traits but zero-sized bounds (ref #10830).
- [ ] Maps missing creeps/neutral player references or with inconsistent ally/enemy configuration for them (ref #11056).
- [ ] Map bound lint tests need to take terrain height into account. (ref #10686)

data.title: Fix Creeps not considering players as enemies on some TD maps
data.body:
Set Multi\* players as enemies for Creeps where this wasn't the case.

Closes #11056.

data.title: Enable Targetable to handle multiple Cloak traits
data.body:
Closes #11159.

Make sure to not just review the code but also test this, including TS.

data.title: Fix replay timer.
data.body: #10478 missed a case.

data.title: Remove unused Concrete armor type from TD weapons.
Actors can't have multiple Cloakable traits
data.body:
Looks like #11154 was poorly tested by us reviewers.

While it fixed #11055, now actors like the TS stealth tank crash the game because they have more than one cloakable trait.

The fix for that would probably be to change

`cloak = self.TraitOrDefault<Cloak>();`

to

`cloak = self.TraitsImplementing<Cloak>().FirstOrDefault(Exts.IsTraitEnabled);`

data.title: Added INotifyFiredSalvo trait interface
data.body:
Notifies once a full salvo has been fired.

Possible usecase is #11108 

Patch to test this on top of #11108 :
https://gist.github.com/teees/26e38296a44c58ffcf3ae9519579e818

data.title: Fix the debris spawned when walls are destroyed in d2k
data.body:
Looks like this on bleed:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/790kwftd2x4mfcv/d2kwalls.gif?dl=0 (File too big to upload it on github).

The debris configuration I added is taken from `^Defense`.

(Discovered by my brother, btw. ;))

data.title: I rephrased. Moving units do not get new targets to attack it.
data.body: but I noticed that if it set his sights on something before the movement itself or on the order, he then shoots while driving

data.title: Moving units do not attack enemy units...
data.body:
If I give move command without "A" button pressed, my Appocalipse tank goes near enemy harvester without attak it. 
In original RA2 Appocalipse and tesla tanks do it automaticaly.

data.title: Fix looking up un-required trait in Targetable ctor
data.body: Fixes #11055.

data.title: Use Contains method on Selection when possible.
data.body: This allows the set to be utilized for a fast check, rather than degrading to a linear search via LINQ.

data.title: Fix reselecting a dropdown option in the lobby causing a server message
data.body:
On bleed: Just reselect an already selected option and you get a "x changed y to z" notification
(although nothing changed).

I tried to put the checks as early as possible without changing other code (as we want to bail out early).
